{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557521,"name":"kuzey","username":"kuzeyatay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/59ef9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T07:18:42.144Z","cooked":"

So as far as i can remember ever since we wired our robot and got onto testing we have been getting the following messages on the driver station(idk if they are related). We have 22 can devices on the same can bus and i thought that might be the problem. I would really apreciate your thought tho. Here’s the messages:

thread '<unnamed>' panicked at src/can_bridge.rs:128:30:

note: run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display a backtrace called Result::unwrap() on an Err value: Cannot assign requested address (os error 99)

Warning 0 [phoenix] Library initialization is complete.

thread '<unnamed>' panicked at /github/home/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/warp-0.3.7/src/server.rs:217:27:

error binding to 0.0.0.0:7171: error creating server listener: Address already in use (os error 98) thread '<unnamed>' panicked at /github/home/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/warp-0.3.7/src/server.rs:217:27: error binding to 0.0.0.0:7171: error creating server listener: Address already in use (os error 98)

It’s an error generated by the grapple vendordep. @Jaci

It looks like it’s trying to create a server on a port, and that port is already in use, probably due to the old robot program not dying in time before the new one starts?

oh that makes sense. we have CanBridge.runTCP(); in Robot.java. Would removing that fix the problem?

It’s true that this is being thrown by libgrapplefrc, but it’s symptomatic of a bigger issue. You’ve got another instance of the user program running somewhere on the RoboRIO. @Peter_Johnson shouldn’t the NI FRC runtime or w/e guarantee this doesn’t happen?
